args: And now, Midgardsormr, you and I shall\nattempt to discover the edge of the sky!
I have no idea about what you speak.
Xiao Lei has come up with a working hypothesis\nsuggesting the sky eventually comes to an end.
She and the prince have come to Midgardsormr\nto ask questions about the sky and mana.
...I see. You feel as though the closer\nyou get to the summit of a mountain,\nthe more the level of mana decreases.
That's the theoryâ€”but we figured we'd\nask you since dragons seem to be well-\nversed in mana and the like.
So then, what's the truth? Do higher places\nreally have a reduced amount of mana?
It is as you have conjectured.\nAs elevation increases, mana is reduced.
I knew it! Oh, but this is such a relief.\nIf it had been disproven, my theory\nwould have fallen apart.
I am rather surprised you noticed.\nThe reduction in mana based on\nelevation is a slight one at best.

If you consider the flow of mana to
be 100 at ground level, the summit
of a mountain would be something
like 90.

Er, if you consider the flow of
mana to be 100 at ground level,
the summit of a mountain would
be something like 90?
Why do you know those numbers\nto such an exact degree?!
We dragons are beings that co-exist\nwith mana; we are acutely aware of\neven the smallest shift in its flow.
In that case... Yes, this should work!
Was that a flash of inspiration?
I have indeedâ€”but it will require the\nassistance of Midgardsormr.
If he is willing to help, I should finally be\nable to calculate the edge of the sky!
Are you willing to assist me in this,\nMidgardsormr? ...Pleeease?
I must confess, you have awakened\nmy interest in unpacking this mystery.
I have completed my investigation.\nIf we consider the mana here to be\n100, it is 99 at the top of the Halidom.
Hmm, I think we may need a more\nfine-grained number. What if we\nconsider this place to be 1,000?
In that case, the Halidom would be 998.
Very good, thank you. I've recorded that.\nNow, the next step, if you would?
The measure at twice the Halidom's\nheight, yes? Give me a moment.
Wait! Are you sure you went up exactly\ntwice the Halidom's height?\nYou didn't miss the mark in the slightest?
...Hmm. Now that you say that,\nI may have made a slight error.

That is unacceptable. Precision is key
when taking measurements such as this.
Our entire endeavor hinges upon your
exacting accuracy!
Now please be attentive to the flapping\nof your wings and fly to PRECISELY\ntwice the height of the Halidom!
You hold sway over the wind itself!\nSurely you can do this, yes?
Very well. I shall provide you the answerâ€”\nand accuracyâ€”that you seek.
This is starting to make my head hurt.\nHow many of these measurements\nare you planning to do?

As many as it takes! We must fine-tune
our measurements to an exacting degree
until we discover exactly how the flow
of mana changes at height.
This will allow us to calculate where\nthe edge of the sky is located!
Give it your all, Midgardsormr!\nI'm counting on you!
The amount of mana at twice the\nHalidom's height was 996.
996, thank you. Next, I need a\nmeasurement at three times the\nHalidom's height.
In this fashion, Midgardsormr took to the skies\ntime and again, until finally...
Thank you, Midgardsormr. Now I should\nbe able to make perfect calculations.
Wow! At a height of more than 20\nHalidoms, the reduction in mana shifts!
So, taking all the data into account,\nthe height where the mana reaches\nzero would be...
Yes! 3,047 Halidoms worth of height!\nTHAT is where the sky ends!
Even I could not have imagined\nsuch a thing.
The number really is unbelievable.\nLet me just double-check...

All right, I've re-run my calculations,
and the number remains the same.
The edge of the sky lies at a height
of 3,047 Halidoms.
Eureka! I've done it! I have pulled back the\ncurtain on the edge of the sky through\nthe power of numbers!
Though I suspect the number 3,047\nHalidoms will hold little meaning\nfor other people...
But it means something to ME,\nand that is what matters!
It's a pretty spectacular outcome.\nCongratulations, Xiao Lei.
Thank you! And thank YOU, Midgardsormr!
Ah! That gives me an idea! Would you\nallow me to ride on your back and\nvisit the edge of the sky?!
I would love to be able to see\nthe edge of the sky for myself!
My apologies, but that is not possible.\nNot even I can reach such a height.
...Wait! I've just had another spark of\ninspiration! I know what my next\nobjective is going to be!

I will reach the edge of the sky and
witness it in person, thereby proving
it with both numbers AND practical
observation!
And how do you intend to do this when\neven the mightiest of dragons cannot?
I will...figure that part out later.\nBut believe me, I WILL figure it out!
After all, however unreasonable it may\nhave appeared, we managed to unlock\nthe secret of the sky's edge!
I've got a feeling you can solve any\nproblem placed in front of you.
Heh. Thanks. Oh, and I'll still be needing\nyour help from here on out, if that's okay.
Because someday we're going to see\nthe edge of the sky together!
